name: NPR
text:
Russia has rejected any blame for the poisoning of Putin critic Alexei Navalny, but a former CIA official says "this is something that the Russian intelligence services have been doing literally for decades, if not longer."
https://t.co/3SM5gwzhRA

name: NPR
text:
RT @BobbyAllyn: Trump's order banning TikTok could make 4,000 freelance teachers in the U.S. lose their jobs, or worse.

One instructor told me: "I could be put in jail for teaching a five-year-old how to say hello from across the computer."

https://t.co/qx7u6Mbe6s

name: NPR
text: Flu season is just around the corner in the Northern Hemisphere — and now there's the coronavirus pandemic, too. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, what lessons can we learn from countries in the Southern Hemisphere where the same thing just happened? https://t.co/ab7b2HvP8r

name: NPR
text:
The start of a school year is prime time for registering college students to vote — and amid the pandemic, mobilization efforts are going virtual.

But campus organizers warn digital tools cannot fully replace face-to-face interaction.
https://t.co/m0Lp8o9p4y

name: NPR
text: The suspect in the fatal shooting of a far-right protester in Portland, Oregon last weekend, was killed by law enforcement attempting to arrest him. In an interview published hours earlier, he said the shooting was an act of self defense. https://t.co/dYhC7V4OJD
